chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Columbus Andra Martin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted 60 days to pay court costs/DNA surcharge. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Bond of $500 applied to restitution - Defendant granted a payment plan for restitution at rate of $25 per month commencing 8/1/2022. The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Defendant Columbus Andra Martin Jr in court in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail. Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Columbus Andra Martin Jr. Atty. Benjamin Lindsay appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Atty. Dvoran motion for bail reduction. State opposes bail reduction. Court denies bail motion.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on July 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
to modify bail, filed by Atty Dvoran. Doc for review to Clerk DK

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No contact with Uhaul businesses, may not rent vehicles.

Court reporter-Michelle Yaklovich - on zoom - 12:57 PM Defendant Columbus Andra Martin Jr in court and by Atty. Heather Dvoran.  Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for PD. State recommends $500 cash. Court orders $500 cash bail w/conditions. Defendant waives time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
